summary: Transitive dependency vulnerability in qs 6.5.3 (CVE-2021-44907) via lerna causes a Denial of Service risk due to insufficient property sanitization in query parsing. The issue was automatically closed after the vulnerable library was removed from inventory.
userImpact: Users are exposed to a potential Denial of Service attack through a vulnerable transitive dependency in the query string parser.
rootCause: Insufficient sanitization of properties in qs.parse() function allowing array property assignment to be converted to objects, potentially causing DoS.
proposedFix: Upgrade qs from 6.5.3 to 6.8.1 or later to address CVE-2021-44907.
resolutionDetails: The vulnerable library was removed from the WhiteSource inventory and the dependency chain was updated, eliminating the transitive dependency on the vulnerable qs version.
keyQuote: A Denial of Service vulnerability exists in qs up to 6.8.0 due to insufficient sanitization of property in the gs.parse function.
